formatted_items.content:
Subject: Sunny Days Childcare – Weekly Classroom Update & A Quick Request

Dear Sunny Days Families,

I hope you’re all doing well! Below is a brief recap of what your little ones have been up to, plus a few dates to note. (A more detailed, day-by-day log with photos is waiting for you in our class Notion workspace—feel free to pop in whenever you’d like.)

Classroom Highlights  
• Science & Sensory: We planted bean seeds and talked about what plants need to grow.  
• Literacy: The children practiced the letter “S,” sounding out words like “sun,” “sand,” and “sail.”  
• Art: Finger-painting with the three primary colors led to lots of surprise discoveries about color-mixing!  
• Social/Emotional: We used cooperative board games to practice turn-taking and sharing encouraging words.

Coming Up  
• Pajama Day – Tuesday, June 11 (children may wear safe, weather-appropriate pajamas and bring a small stuffed friend)  
• Father’s Day Breakfast – Friday, June 14, 8:00 a.m.–9:00 a.m. in the multipurpose room  
• June Theme – “Under the Sea”: look for ocean-themed books, songs, and sensory tubs all month long.

Reminders  
• Please send in a labeled sunhat and a bottle of sunscreen for outdoor play.  
• June tuition is due by Wednesday, June 5.  
• We’re looking for parent guest readers; reply if you’d like to share a favorite story with the class!

A Quick Request  
To help us finish planning our July/August Summer Program roster, could you kindly email me by Friday, June 7 and let us know whether your child will attend? Even a simple “Yes, attending” or “No, we’ll be away” is perfect. Your prompt reply makes our staffing and activity planning much smoother—thank you in advance!

As always, if you have any questions, comments, or fun ideas, feel free to reach out. It’s a joy spending each day with your children, and I appreciate your continued partnership.

Warmly,  
Jane  
Lead Teacher, Sunshine Room  
Sunny Days Childcare Center
